ko.explanation: 부모와 자녀 등으로 이루어진 집단. 함께 사는 사람들.

examples.advanced: 가족은 가장 소중한 존재라고 생각해요.
examples.master: 가족의 의미는 시대에 따라 변화하지만, 서로를 아끼는 마음은 변하지 않는다.

en.explanation: A group consisting of parents and children. People who live together.

examples.beginner: How many people are in your family?
examples.intermediate: I eat dinner with my family.
examples.advanced: I think family is the most precious thing.
examples.master: The meaning of family changes with the times, but the love for each other remains unchanged.

ko.explanation: 자기를 낳아 준 여자. 어머니의 낮춤말.

examples.advanced: 엄마의 생일 선물로 뭘 사드릴까 고민 중이에요.
examples.master: 엄마가 되고 나서야 부모님의 마음을 조금은 이해할 수 있게 되었다.

en.explanation: The woman who gave birth to you. Informal word for mother.

examples.advanced: I'm thinking about what to buy for mom's birthday present.
examples.master: Only after becoming a mom myself could I begin to understand my parents' hearts.

examples.advanced: 아빠와 함께 야구 경기를 보러 갔어요.
examples.master: 아빠의 어깨가 예전보다 좁아 보이는 것을 보고 마음이 아팠다.

en.explanation: An affectionate way to call one's father.

examples.advanced: I went to watch a baseball game with dad.
examples.master: Seeing dad's shoulders look smaller than before made my heart ache.

ko.explanation: 자기를 낳아 준 여자. 엄마의 높임말.

examples.advanced: 어머니의 건강이 좋아지셔서 다행이에요.
examples.master: 어머니의 손맛을 따라가려면 아직 멀었다는 것을 요리할 때마다 느낀다.

en.explanation: The woman who gave birth to you. Formal/polite word for mom.

examples.advanced: I'm glad that mother's health has improved.
examples.master: Every time I cook, I realize I still have a long way to go to match mother's touch.

ko.explanation: 자기를 낳아 준 남자. 아빠의 높임말.

examples.advanced: 아버지께서 은퇴하신 후로 취미 생활을 즐기고 계세요.
examples.master: 아버지의 조언이 어렸을 때는 잔소리처럼 느껴졌는데, 지금은 소중한 가르침이었음을 안다.

en.explanation: The man who fathered you. Formal/polite word for dad.

examples.advanced: Since father retired, he's been enjoying his hobbies.
examples.master: When I was young, father's advice felt like nagging, but now I know it was precious guidance.

examples.advanced: 부모님의 결혼기념일에 함께 외식을 했어요.
examples.master: 부모가 되어 보니 내 부모님의 희생이 얼마나 컸는지 비로소 알게 되었다.

en.explanation: Father and mother.

examples.advanced: We went out to eat together for my parents' anniversary.
examples.master: Only after becoming a parent myself did I finally realize how great my parents' sacrifices were.

ko.explanation: 남자가 형제 중 자기보다 나이가 많은 남자를 이르는 말.

examples.advanced: 형이 외국에서 일하고 있어서 자주 못 만나요.
examples.master: 어렸을 때는 형이 싫었는데, 어른이 되고 나니 가장 의지가 되는 사람이 됐다.

en.explanation: Term used by males to address their older brother.

examples.intermediate: My older brother is a college student.
examples.advanced: My older brother works abroad, so we don't meet often.
examples.master: When I was young, I didn't like my brother, but after growing up, he became my most reliable person.

ko.explanation: 남자가 형제 중 자기보다 나이가 많은 여자를 이르는 말.

examples.advanced: 누나가 맛있는 음식을 만들어 줬어요.
examples.master: 어렸을 때 누나가 항상 숙제를 도와줬던 것이 지금도 고마운 기억으로 남아있다.

en.explanation: Term used by males to address their older sister.

examples.advanced: My older sister made me delicious food.
examples.master: The memories of my sister always helping with my homework when I was young still remain as grateful memories.

ko.explanation: 여자가 형제 중 자기보다 나이가 많은 남자를 이르는 말.

examples.advanced: 오빠가 운전을 가르쳐 줬어요.
examples.master: 오빠라는 호칭은 가족뿐만 아니라 친한 선배에게도 사용할 수 있다.

en.explanation: Term used by females to address their older brother.

examples.intermediate: My older brother went to the military.
examples.advanced: My older brother taught me how to drive.
examples.master: The term 'oppa' can be used not only for family but also for close seniors.

ko.explanation: 여자가 형제 중 자기보다 나이가 많은 여자를 이르는 말.

examples.advanced: 언니가 취직해서 독립했어요.
examples.master: 언니는 내게 패션 조언을 해주는 가장 믿을 만한 사람이다.

en.explanation: Term used by females to address their older sister.

examples.intermediate: I go shopping with my older sister.
examples.advanced: My older sister got a job and became independent.
examples.master: My older sister is the most reliable person for fashion advice.

ko.explanation: 나이가 어린 형제나 자매. 남동생과 여동생을 모두 포함.

examples.advanced: 동생이 시험을 잘 봐서 기쁘게 축하해 줬어요.
examples.master: 동생을 돌봐 온 경험이 나중에 부모가 되었을 때 큰 도움이 됐다.

en.explanation: A younger brother or sister. Includes both younger brothers and sisters.

examples.beginner: Do you have a younger sibling?
examples.intermediate: My younger sibling is a high school student.
examples.advanced: My younger sibling did well on the exam, so I happily congratulated them.
examples.master: The experience of taking care of my younger sibling was a great help when I became a parent.

examples.advanced: 남동생이 올해 대학에 입학했어요.
examples.master: 남동생이 어느새 나보다 키가 훨씬 커져서 놀랐다.

en.explanation: A male sibling who is younger.

examples.advanced: My younger brother entered university this year.
examples.master: I was surprised that my younger brother has grown much taller than me before I knew it.

examples.advanced: 여동생의 결혼식 준비를 도와주고 있어요.
examples.master: 여동생과 어렸을 때는 자주 싸웠지만, 지금은 가장 친한 친구가 됐다.

en.explanation: A female sibling who is younger.

examples.intermediate: My younger sister plays the piano.
examples.advanced: I'm helping with my younger sister's wedding preparations.
examples.master: My younger sister and I used to fight a lot when we were young, but now we've become best friends.

examples.advanced: 할머니가 맛있는 음식을 많이 만들어 주셨어요.
examples.master: 할머니의 옛날 이야기를 들으면 역사책에서는 배울 수 없는 것들을 배울 수 있다.

en.explanation: The mother of one's father or mother.

examples.advanced: Grandmother made lots of delicious food.
examples.master: Listening to grandmother's old stories teaches things you can't learn from history books.

examples.advanced: 할아버지께서 건강하게 지내셔서 다행이에요.
examples.master: 할아버지가 젊었을 때 겪은 전쟁 이야기를 들으면 마음이 숙연해진다.

en.explanation: The father of one's father or mother.

examples.intermediate: Grandfather takes walks in the park.
examples.advanced: I'm glad that grandfather is healthy.
examples.master: Hearing grandfather's stories about the war he experienced when he was young makes my heart solemn.

examples.advanced: 명절에는 조부모님을 뵙기 위해 고향에 가요.
examples.master: 조부모님이 건강하게 오래 사셔서 4대가 함께 모이는 것이 가능했다.

en.explanation: Grandfather and grandmother.

examples.intermediate: My grandparents' house is in the countryside.
examples.advanced: During holidays, I go to my hometown to see my grandparents.
examples.master: Because my grandparents lived long and healthy, it was possible for four generations to gather together.

examples.advanced: 아들이 취직해서 부모님이 정말 기뻐하세요.
examples.master: 아들을 키우면서 내 아버지의 마음을 조금이나마 이해하게 되었다.

en.explanation: A male child in relation to their parents.

examples.advanced: My son got a job, and my parents are very happy.
examples.master: While raising my son, I came to understand my father's heart a little.

examples.advanced: 딸이 외국으로 유학을 가서 보고 싶어요.
examples.master: 딸을 시집 보내는 아버지의 마음은 말로 표현할 수 없을 정도로 복잡하다.

en.explanation: A female child in relation to their parents.

examples.advanced: My daughter went abroad to study, so I miss her.
examples.master: The heart of a father sending his daughter off to be married is too complex to express in words.

examples.advanced: 자녀를 위해 열심히 저축하고 있어요.
examples.master: 부모는 자녀의 행복을 위해서라면 무엇이든 희생할 준비가 되어 있다.

en.explanation: Sons and daughters. Offspring.

examples.advanced: I'm saving hard for my children.
examples.master: Parents are ready to sacrifice anything for their children's happiness.

examples.advanced: 할머니가 손녀에게 옛날이야기를 들려주세요.
examples.master: 손녀가 태어났을 때 할아버지가 기뻐서 눈물을 흘리셨다.

en.explanation: The daughter of one's son or daughter.

examples.advanced: Grandmother tells old stories to her granddaughter.
examples.master: When his granddaughter was born, grandfather shed tears of joy.

examples.advanced: 할아버지가 손자에게 바둑을 가르쳐 주세요.
examples.master: 손자가 할아버지의 이름을 부르며 뛰어오는 모습이 가장 행복한 순간이다.

en.explanation: The son of one's son or daughter.

examples.advanced: Grandfather teaches his grandson Go (the board game).
examples.master: The happiest moment is when my grandson calls my name and comes running.

ko.explanation: 아버지의 남자 형제. 또는 부모의 남자 형제를 친근하게 부르는 말.

examples.advanced: 삼촌은 외국에서 일하고 계세요.
examples.master: 어렸을 때 삼촌이 놀아주던 기억이 지금도 따뜻하게 남아있다.

en.explanation: Father's brother. Or an affectionate term for a parent's brother.

examples.advanced: My uncle works abroad.
examples.master: The memories of my uncle playing with me when I was young still remain warm.

examples.advanced: 이모가 요리를 정말 잘하세요.
examples.master: 이모는 엄마처럼 따뜻하게 대해 주셔서 친정에 가는 것 같은 편안함이 있다.

en.explanation: Mother's sister.

examples.advanced: My aunt cooks really well.
examples.master: My aunt treats me as warmly as my mother, so there's a comfort like going to my maternal home.

examples.advanced: 고모네 집에서 명절을 보냈어요.
examples.master: 고모는 아버지와 닮아서 그런지 아버지처럼 편안하게 느껴진다.

en.explanation: Father's sister.

examples.advanced: We spent the holiday at my aunt's house.
examples.master: My aunt feels as comfortable as my father, maybe because she resembles him.

examples.advanced: 외삼촌은 항상 재미있는 이야기를 해 주세요.
examples.master: 외삼촌은 어머니와 매우 닮아서 외삼촌을 보면 어머니가 떠오른다.

en.explanation: Mother's brother.

examples.advanced: My uncle always tells interesting stories.
examples.master: My uncle looks so much like my mother that I think of her when I see him.

ko.explanation: 삼촌, 고모, 이모, 외삼촌의 자녀. 부모의 형제자매의 자녀.

examples.advanced: 명절에 사촌들이 다 모여서 즐거웠어요.
examples.master: 어렸을 때 사촌들과 함께 보낸 여름 방학의 추억이 가장 소중하다.

en.explanation: Children of one's uncles and aunts.

examples.advanced: It was fun because all the cousins gathered during the holiday.
examples.master: The memories of summer vacations spent with cousins when I was young are the most precious.

examples.advanced: 조카의 돌잔치에 갔어요.
examples.master: 조카들이 자라는 것을 보면 시간이 정말 빨리 간다는 것을 실감한다.

en.explanation: The child of one's brother or sister.

examples.advanced: I went to my nephew/niece's first birthday party.
examples.master: Watching my nieces and nephews grow up makes me realize how fast time passes.

ko.explanation: 결혼한 여자에게 있어서 그 짝이 되는 남자.

examples.advanced: 남편과 함께 결혼 10주년 기념 여행을 갔어요.
examples.master: 좋은 남편이 되려면 상대방의 말에 귀 기울이는 것이 가장 중요하다.

en.explanation: The male partner in a marriage to a woman.

examples.advanced: I went on a trip with my husband for our 10th wedding anniversary.
examples.master: To be a good husband, the most important thing is to listen to your partner.

ko.explanation: 결혼한 남자에게 있어서 그 짝이 되는 여자.

examples.advanced: 아내와 함께 주말마다 등산을 해요.
examples.master: 아내의 지지와 응원이 있었기에 지금의 성공이 가능했다.

en.explanation: The female partner in a marriage to a man.

examples.advanced: I go hiking with my wife every weekend.
examples.master: My current success was possible because of my wife's support and encouragement.

examples.advanced: 부부 사이에는 서로 존중하는 것이 중요해요.
examples.master: 부부의 관계는 매일의 작은 배려와 이해로 더욱 깊어진다.

en.explanation: Husband and wife. Two married people.

examples.intermediate: That couple gets along very well.
examples.advanced: It's important for couples to respect each other.
examples.master: A couple's relationship deepens through daily small considerations and understanding.

examples.advanced: 명절에 시부모님 댁에 갔어요.
examples.master: 시부모님과의 관계는 한국 문화에서 중요한 가족 관계 중 하나이다.

en.explanation: The husband's parents. Father-in-law and mother-in-law.

examples.advanced: I visited my parents-in-law's house during the holiday.
examples.master: The relationship with in-laws is one of the important family relationships in Korean culture.

examples.advanced: 장모님께 생일 선물을 드렸어요.
examples.master: 장모님은 저를 친아들처럼 대해 주셔서 항상 감사하다.

en.explanation: The wife's mother.

examples.advanced: I gave a birthday present to my mother-in-law.
examples.master: I'm always grateful that my mother-in-law treats me like her own son.

examples.advanced: 장인어른의 조언을 항상 감사히 듣고 있어요.
examples.master: 장인어른과의 관계가 좋으면 결혼 생활이 더욱 원활해진다.

en.explanation: The wife's father.

examples.intermediate: I went fishing with my father-in-law.
examples.advanced: I always gratefully listen to my father-in-law's advice.
examples.master: When you have a good relationship with your father-in-law, married life becomes smoother.

examples.advanced: 며느리가 손자를 데리고 왔어요.
examples.master: 며느리를 친딸처럼 대하면 가족 간의 화목이 유지된다.

en.explanation: The son's wife.

examples.advanced: My daughter-in-law brought my grandson.
examples.master: Treating your daughter-in-law like your own daughter maintains family harmony.

examples.advanced: 사위가 명절에 선물을 가져왔어요.
examples.master: 한국에는 '사위 사랑은 장모'라는 속담이 있을 정도로 장모와 사위의 관계는 특별하다.

en.explanation: The daughter's husband.

examples.advanced: My son-in-law brought presents during the holiday.
examples.master: In Korea, there's even a saying 'The mother-in-law loves the son-in-law,' showing the special relationship between them.

examples.advanced: 친척 어른들께 세배를 했어요.
examples.master: 친척 관계는 멀어지기 쉽지만, 명절은 그 관계를 유지하는 좋은 기회가 된다.

en.explanation: People who are related by blood.

examples.advanced: I bowed to my elder relatives during the holiday.
examples.master: Relative relationships can easily drift apart, but holidays are good opportunities to maintain those ties.

examples.advanced: 결혼식을 내년 봄에 하기로 했어요.
examples.master: 결혼은 두 사람의 시작이자 두 가족의 만남이기도 하다.

en.explanation: The act of a man and woman becoming husband and wife.

examples.advanced: We decided to have the wedding next spring.
examples.master: Marriage is the beginning of two people and also the meeting of two families.

examples.advanced: 이혼 후에도 아이들을 함께 양육하기로 했어요.
examples.master: 이혼은 끝이 아니라 새로운 시작이 될 수도 있다.

en.explanation: The legal separation of a married couple.

examples.advanced: We decided to co-parent even after the divorce.
examples.master: Divorce is not the end; it can also be a new beginning.

ko.explanation: 가깝게 오래 사귄 사람. 또는 나이가 같은 사람.

examples.advanced: 오랜 친구를 만나서 옛날 이야기를 많이 했어요.
examples.master: 진정한 친구는 어려울 때 곁에 있어주는 사람이라고 생각해요.

en.explanation: A person you've known closely for a long time. Or someone of the same age.

examples.intermediate: I watched a movie with a friend.
examples.advanced: I met an old friend and talked a lot about old times.
examples.master: I think a true friend is someone who stays by your side during difficult times.

examples.advanced: 연인 사이에는 서로를 이해하려는 노력이 필요해요.
examples.master: 연인 관계에서 가장 중요한 것은 솔직한 대화라고 생각한다.

en.explanation: Two people in a romantic relationship.

examples.beginner: Do you have a romantic partner?
examples.intermediate: I went on a date with my partner.
examples.advanced: Couples need to make efforts to understand each other.
examples.master: I think the most important thing in a romantic relationship is honest communication.

examples.advanced: 남자친구와 3년째 사귀고 있어요.
examples.master: 좋은 남자친구의 조건은 사람마다 다르지만, 서로 존중하는 것이 기본이다.

en.explanation: A man that a woman is dating.

examples.advanced: I've been dating my boyfriend for 3 years.
examples.master: The qualities of a good boyfriend differ for everyone, but mutual respect is fundamental.

examples.advanced: 여자친구에게 프러포즈하려고 반지를 샀어요.
examples.master: 여자친구와의 관계를 유지하려면 작은 것에도 감사하는 마음이 중요하다.

en.explanation: A woman that a man is dating.

examples.advanced: I bought a ring to propose to my girlfriend.
examples.master: To maintain a relationship with your girlfriend, being grateful for small things is important.

ko.explanation: 같은 학교나 직장에서 먼저 들어온 사람.

examples.advanced: 회사 선배에게 업무에 대해 많이 배웠어요.
examples.master: 좋은 선배는 후배에게 지식뿐만 아니라 태도도 가르친다.

en.explanation: Someone who entered the same school or workplace earlier.

examples.advanced: I learned a lot about work from my company senior.
examples.master: A good senior teaches juniors not only knowledge but also attitude.

ko.explanation: 같은 학교나 직장에서 나중에 들어온 사람.

examples.advanced: 회사 후배들과 함께 회식을 했어요.
examples.master: 후배를 잘 이끌어 주는 것도 선배의 중요한 역할이다.

en.explanation: Someone who entered the same school or workplace later.

examples.intermediate: I gave advice to a junior.
examples.advanced: I had a dinner gathering with my company juniors.
examples.master: Guiding juniors well is also an important role of seniors.

examples.advanced: 오랜만에 동창회에서 친구들을 만났어요.
examples.master: 동창회에 가면 학창 시절의 추억이 새록새록 떠오른다.

en.explanation: A gathering of people who graduated from the same school.

examples.advanced: I met friends at the reunion after a long time.
examples.master: Going to a reunion brings back vivid memories of school days.

examples.advanced: 이웃 사촌이라는 말처럼 가까운 이웃은 가족 같아요.
examples.master: 요즘은 이웃 간의 교류가 줄어들어 서로 얼굴을 모르는 경우도 많다.

en.explanation: A person who lives nearby.

examples.advanced: Close neighbors are like family, as the saying goes.
examples.master: These days, interactions between neighbors have decreased, and often people don't even know each other's faces.

examples.advanced: 노인 돌봄 서비스를 이용하고 있어요.
examples.master: 가족 돌봄은 사랑의 표현이자 책임이다.

en.explanation: Taking care of someone with concern.

examples.advanced: We're using elderly care services.
examples.master: Family caregiving is an expression of love and responsibility.

ko.explanation: 같은 부모에게서 태어난 사람들. 형, 오빠, 누나, 언니, 동생.

examples.advanced: 형제자매 사이가 좋으면 부모님도 기뻐하세요.
examples.master: 어릴 때는 형제자매와 자주 싸웠지만, 커서는 가장 든든한 지원군이 된다.

en.explanation: People born from the same parents.

examples.advanced: When siblings get along, parents are happy too.
examples.master: Although I used to fight often with my siblings when young, they become the strongest supporters when we grow up.

examples.advanced: 외동은 부모님의 사랑을 독차지할 수 있지만, 형제가 없어서 외로울 때도 있어요.
examples.master: 요즘 한국에서는 출산율이 낮아서 외동이 점점 많아지고 있다.

en.explanation: A child with no siblings. Only daughter, only son.

examples.intermediate: I grew up as an only child, so I envy people with siblings.
examples.advanced: An only child can monopolize parents' love, but sometimes feels lonely without siblings.
examples.master: These days in Korea, the birth rate is low, so there are more and more only children.

ko.explanation: 같은 때에 태어난 형제나 자매. 일란성 쌍둥이와 이란성 쌍둥이가 있다.

examples.advanced: 쌍둥이는 닮아서 구분하기 어려울 때가 있어요.
examples.master: 일란성 쌍둥이는 외모는 똑같지만 성격이 다른 경우가 많다고 한다.

en.explanation: Siblings born at the same time. There are identical twins and fraternal twins.

examples.advanced: Twins look alike, so it's sometimes hard to tell them apart.
examples.master: They say identical twins may look the same, but often have different personalities.
